# Sai Surbehera

Sai Surbehera is a Machine Learning Engineer for Walmart's Algorithmic Search Experience Team, specializing in synthetic data generation for navigation. Holds a Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science from Columbia University and an undergraduate degree in Information from the University of Michigan. Professional experience includes:

- Synthetic data generation for navigation and search experience optimization at Walmart Search, focusing on improving algorithmic search performance.
- Development of price prediction algorithms, cold start models, and click-through rate (CTR) prediction models at Walmart Search, targeting e-commerce search and recommendation systems.
- Implementation of geocoding algorithms at Philadelphia Inquirer and Columbia Journalism, enabling location-based data processing and mapping.
- Construction of information extraction pipelines at American Family Insurance, automating the extraction of structured data from unstructured sources for insurance applications.
- Design of relation extraction pipelines at Mindgram, facilitating the identification and classification of relationships between entities in text for mental health and AI applications.
- Development of knowledge graph search and entity linking systems at University of Michigan Giving, supporting advanced search and semantic linking for donor and giving data.
- Creation of theme-matching algorithms and text summarization systems at University of Stellenbosch, enabling automated content analysis and summarization for academic and research purposes.
- Fraud detection using GraphSage at AAA Insurance, leveraging graph neural networks to identify anomalous patterns and prevent insurance fraud.

Personal interests include working on independent projects, reading and writing about philosophy, and listening to music during free time.

Primary location: New York City (NYC).
